master.description: The URL of the Mesos master. This should point to the Mesos ZNode on the Zookeeper machine.

failover-timeout.description: The time before Mesos kills a scheduler and tasks if it has not recovered (ms).

zookeeper-mesos-timeout.description: The timeout for connecting to zookeeper for Mesos (ms).

port.description: The port number of the ES-Mesos management front-end. Defaults to 8080.

force-pull-image.description: Forces docker to re-pull the image.

ram.description: The amount of ram that Mesos shall give give to the executors.

cpu.description: The amount of CPU resource to allocate to the elasticsearch instance.

disk.description: The amount of Disk resource to allocate to the elasticsearch instance (MB).

instances.description: The number of elasticsearch nodes to be instantiated. It is recommended that you provide an odd number, to prevent split brain issues.

settings-location.description: URI to ES yml settings file. If file is copied to all slaves, the file must be in /tmp/config. E.g. 'file:/tmp/config/elasticsearch.yml', 'http://webserver.com/elasticsearch.yml'

health-delay.description: The delay between executor healthcheck requests (ms).

name.description: The name given to the executor task.

timeout.description: The maximum executor healthcheck timeout (ms). Must be greater than elasticsearch.executor.healthdelay. Will start new executor after this length of time.

cpu.description: The amount of CPU that Mesos shall allocate to the scheduler.

ram.description: The amount of RAM that Mesos shall allocate to the scheduler.

java-heap.description: The java heap space environmental variables to pass to the scheduler
